Patch Set 13:

(1 comment)

Patch Set 13:

(1 comment)

Dear All,
Please help us to review this new feature according customer requirement. Thanks.

Sincerely,
Tim

Dear Benjamin,

Thanks your reviewing and suggestion.
We've updated new patchset, please help us to review and merge it. Thanks.

Sincerely,
Tim
${DEVICE_GEN} instead?
Done
I think this step needs to be done in `do_deploy` instead
Done
should this be ${DEVICE_GEN} again?
Done
might be more readable if you return from the function immediately if SECURED_IMAGE isn't true
Done
does the python script not return error status when it fails? that would be more reliable than grepping for error messages
Yes, the original python script didn't return error when sign is failed or key is invalid. We need to stop keep building final image-bmc when sign images got failed. Thanks.
why a separate variable?
Done
this dependency should probably be updated to after `do_sign_binary`
Done
If latest TIP FW (binary) is enforcing signature check, it should be set to True and inherited by all machines.
Indeed, you are right. Thanks your review. We've changed it. Thanks.
please update this in the commit message too if "True" is the default
Done

Does HSM signing can work, what's the plan for enabling this?

This would require adding dependency on opensc-native package.

But in addition, IGPS is hardcoding [1] "pkcs11-tool.exe" instead of pkcs11-tool.

[1] - https://github.com/Nuvoton-Israel/igps-npcm8xx/blob/30086cd06bee63c5715622a624620c30ade6652e/py_scripts/ImageGeneration/BinarySignatureGenerator.py#LL246C1-L247C1

Default keys are stored in external Nuvoton repo [1]. Shouldn't they be in OpenBMC project?

[1] - https://github.com/Nuvoton-Israel/igps-npcm8xx/tree/main/py_scripts/ImageGeneration/keys
We need to check with internally according this requirement. Thanks your review.
Thanks all your help to review. Updated new patch and comment.

Seems there is private key of OpenBMC project, but we didn't try to use this kind of key format. Temporary, we just use default keys from external repo. We need to investigate this one internally also. Thank you.

IGPS contains a set of default keys. If a user wishes too, he\she can delete any of the default keys and IGPS will regenerate a new key instead.
I put in IGPS a set of default keys as place holder to speed up build flow.
We do not recommend using those default keys, since the private key is published in GitHub.
Thank you for your clear description for this question.

KEY_SIGN is misleading, it's not key name like KEY_BL31, please change it to SIGN_TYPE.
Also add comment on valid types ('openssl' or 'hsm').
Done
This should be done only when using default keys and not customer keys or when using hsm?
Done
Is this common for npcm7xx or only npcm8xx?
It's common for npcm8xx only. Thanks.

1. For consistency, can you rename these -

SKMT_BL31_KEY_INDEX
SKMT_BL32_KEY_INDEX
SKMT_BL33_KEY_INDEX

All these keys go to SKMT.

2. Also, rename this `keys.inc` (too generic) file to `igps-keys.inc`.
Done

Dear Benjamin,
Could you please kindly help us to merge this commit? Thank you so much.

Sincerely,
Tim
